channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road works hazard sign (A-frame type) abandoned on pavement outside 20 Craybrooke Road, 11th September
item.description:
A Road works hazard sign (A-frame type) has been left on the pavement outside 20 Craybrooke Road, Sidcup. It appears to have no identity on it in terms of who owns it. It appearsto be in good condition. It has been abandoned for over a week. Please could you remove it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Craybrooke Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sydenham Hill SE26 at the junction of Crystal Pala, 11th September
item.description:

item.title: Broken transit carrying a broken Merc on Conduit Road, 11th September
item.description:
Broken down recovery trick carrying Mercedes on Conduit Road. Has flat tires and not roadworthy. Been broken down on side of the road for months, blocking residence from using parking space, which are few and far between in the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Conduit Road, London

item.title: Building Rubble Dumped, 11th September
item.description:
Originally reported under Reference Number 8088068. The shopping trolley and bucket seem to have been cleared but the rubble still remains. Not sure if this rubble is the remains of the previous fly tip or a new fly tip in the same place. It really needs to be cleared up as this rubble consists of ceramic wall tiles and is a danger to wildlife.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hutchins Road, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose setts at top of Hatherley Road, 11th September
item.description:
The granite setts forming the road surface at the top of Hatherley Road (Sidcup High St end) are loose and not fixed securely - they make an unacceptable amount of noise when you drive over them and loose setts are a hazardous surface for cars and pedestrians that obviously needs to be replaced. These issues are far more important than the look of the setts - in fact the loose setts makes Sidcup look like a badly maintained area - PLEASE can you just replace them with normal road surface asap. Also it is dangerous for children and the partially sighted - there is no clear separation between the road and the pavement. This problem has been there for over a year (far too long).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Road, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
